Package it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.attachedProperties

Attached properties offer means for dynamically extending objects (exposing the PropertyTarget interface) with custom attributes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    PropertyListener<V>
    The listener interface for receiving events regarding the change of property values.
    PropertyTarget
    The interface provides methods for dynamically extending objects by attaching and detaching properties.
    Replicating
    The observable interface offers methods listening object replications by means of ReplicationListener.
    ReplicationListener
    The listener interface for receiving replication events.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DelegatedProperty<V>
    Properties created from this class delegate the values handling to some other property.
    DelegatedProperty.PropertySetter<V>
    A secret used to write a DelegatedProperty.
    Property<V>
    An attached property holds some value and can be dynamically attached (and detached) to extend objects created from classes implementing the PropertyTarget interface.
    PropertyContainer
    The class provides a default implementation of the PropertyTarget interface.
    ProtectedProperty<V>
    Properties created from this class can be written only by means of a secret in the form of an instance of ProtectedProperty.ValueSetter.
    ProtectedProperty.ValueSetter<V>
    A secret used to set the value of a protected property.
    ReplicatingProperty<V>
    A class for properties attached to targets implementing Replicating.
    ReplicationListenerContainer
    The class provides an helper for implementing Replicating interface.
    SharedProperty<V>
    A class for properties to be shared between targets implementing Replicating.
    SimpleProperty<V>
    The class provides a basic concretization of Property.

Package it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.attachedProperties Description

Attached properties offer means for dynamically extending objects (exposing the PropertyTarget interface) with custom attributes. Moreover, changes in the value held by these properties can be observed and intercepted.
